headline: Vanilla Cupcake
description: This vanilla cupcake recipe is made with just 5 ingredients; simple, easy, and delicious! Decorate with your favorite vanilla frosting.
name: Vanilla Cupcake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners.

Beat sugar and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla extract. Stir in flour just until mixed; spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until the tops spring back when lightly pressed, 18 to 20 minutes. Cool in the tin briefly before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: I think 1 1/2 cups of flower is too much, which makes it hard and dry.
i was able to make more than 12 cupcakes
loved it! great recipe! keep it up!
Making the cupcake was super easy. And the cupcake? Well, it was super tasty and I loved it!
Easy to make. Tastes absolutely delicious. Thank you.
VERY VERY YUMMY CUPCAKES
SO GOOD
I messed up on the butter didn’t but enough but stiff these are delicious!! Not to sweet definitely will make a again

All I have to say is that I have baked for a long time, so I have the experience not to over stir and all that stuff. This cupcake recipe leaves you with a hard type cake texture that is more like a cookie than anything else. Very interesting!
Followed the recipe perfectly and mine turned out dense and dry. Not something I'll make again
My cupcakes came out hard as a brick I almost chipped a tooth ! But the flavor was pretty good
This is an amazing rescue and I added honey, cinnamon and sprinkles. It got really thick so I added a little bit of water! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

These were soo light and fluffy WITH MODIFICATIONS. This is going to be my go-to cupcake recipe, and is also the perfect base for other add ons

Modifications: 
- 1 cup superfine sugar (1 cup instead of 3/4, I also pulsed regular sugar in a Nutri bullet a couple of times, since I did not have "superfine" sugar)
- 2 eggs instead of 3
- 2 teaspoon vanilla extract instead of 1
- 1/2 cup of almond milk, or any milk. 
- I just mixed the ingredients with a spatula, you don't need to spend time overworking the batter with an electric mixer
I loved it!!
delicious! everyone in my family now loves them, and they are my dads new favorite!

I changed it a little. I didn't have self rising flour so I replaced it with 1.5 cup of plain flour with 2 teaspoons of baking powder and 1 teaspoon of salt. I only added two eggs and 3/4 cup of milk. Came out perfect! Soft and fluffy.

OMG. BEST. CUPCAKES. EVER. These are very very good. I LOVE THEM !!!! I made my own buttercream icing to go on it that made it so much better then it already was. Its my mom’s birthday today so I decided to make her cupcakes. I found this recipe and Oh My God these were sooooo good!!!!!
When I made this I followed the recipe exactly but making a smaller portion when they came out of the oven they tasted fine but were small and dense
It tasted amazing! I recommend this recipe a lot!

I have made this a couple of times. I read the comments to make it better by adding 1/4 cup of sugar and 3/4 cups of milk. And since i used cake flour I added 1 1/2 tsp of baking powder and a little bit of baking soda and a pinch of salt.
This is the best cupcake recipe ever
It looks like muffins. But I think that it was my fault. This is a great recipe! Tastes delicious.
Great cupcakes! Very tasty, crunchy outside, moist inside. I didn't have self-rising flour, so I used all purpose unbleached flour. Sifted raw cane sugar. Didn't change anything else.
the batter was thicc
these were really good and easy enough for my son to help with the baking.
These cupcakes are really good! My picky kids love them!! I did add a little bit of milk and baking powder. Also, my daughter loves chocolate, so I added 2 tbs to half of the mix.

Before making these I thoroughly read through people.s comments and most were complaining about the cupcakes coming out dry. So I made the modifications which were suggested here. I substituted one egg with a cup of milk, added 1/4 cup more sugar and a spoon of cooking oil and they came out perfectly

Before making these I thoroughly read through people.s comments and most were complaining about the cupcakes coming out dry. So I made the modifications which were suggested here. I substituted one egg with a cup of milk, added 1/4 cup more sugar and a spoon of cooking oil and they came out perfectly
I made these and they turned out very dry. The consistency was like cookie batter. Would not recommend making these.
This is a great recipe! Very quick to whip up and they come out with a wonderful texture and flavour. Don't over mix the flour with the other ingredients and it comes out great.
It did turn out a bit dry but it still tasted good

Awesome cupcakes.... made a small modification, added one stick of softened butter and one cup raw cane sugar... these cupcakes couldn’t have been any better. Me and my year old had loads of fun making them.
I was very hesitant considering some of the reviews, but I made them anyway and they're really good
My batter went nuts! When I mixed butter and sugar, it clumped up and was NOT LIGHT AND FLUFFY. After 30 minutes of mixing it finally became light
Loved it so light and fluffy

These turned out great! I was looking for cupcakes for Easter, and I’m glad I found this one. Some suggestions that I had was that I substituted the sour cream for 1/2 cup of milk, and added sprinkles. I also baked them for 17 minutes instead of 19, and they were perfect!
They were delicious and light, but my second batch came out like bread. Don't over-bake them!
This recipe was very easy to do and the cupcakes are delicious. The only downfall I would say is that they could be more moist

I made these yesterday, I followed the recipe to the penny and I was so disappointed. They were dry, and tasted like I had put cornmeal in them. I may try putting more flavoring and maybe some sour cream in them next time, if I decide to make them again.
Awesome
Made it with both Poweder(icing) sugar and caster sugar and in both cases it came out excellent
I steamed instead of baking. The cupcakes were so light and fluffy!

These were fluffy and yummy! Rave reviews from the family. I didn’t have self rising flour on-hand so I looked up how to make it and it was simple. I reduced the sugar just a bit and it was a perfect balance with the homemade frosting I made.
Easy to make , but it changed color after mixing

they tasted sooooo GOOD!
I loved them. Made them for a party and they were awesome!!
love them! Not as unhealthy as other recipes. also, very easy to make!!!!
Tastes like corn bread but corn bread and frosting tastes amazing
Came out nice and fluffy. Everybody loved them!
Listening to another guy's comments, I substituted 1 egg for a cup of milk, and it turned out great, although it needed a tad more sugar... but icing would balance it out pretty nicely.
Great recipe!!! I doubled it and it tasted fine. Just the right amount of sugar ??
I love this
Tasty and beutiful
i would so make this again, my family loved it, i also added some strawberry topping to the center
The cupcakes were very dense and did not have a good flavor

My batter was very dry so I added an extra egg. By doing so, I had to stir more which resulted in a heavier cupcake consistency. Taste was great though. I chose to try this recipe because some reviews stated it wasn't sweet enough. I made it for the birthday of a diabetic relative and didn't want store bought or sickly sweet. I'd try it again with the extra egg added when it should have been added. BTW I used large eggs.
I added milk to make the cupcakes softer

If you are looking for light, airy, and moist cupcakes like I was, this is probably NOT the recipe for you. They were very dense and dry. I’m was very disappointed with this recipe. The only reason why I put 2 stars was because the flavor was delicious. If the cupcakes’ texture was better, this would be a fantastic recipe. I probably won’t use this recipe again. Bummer.
No flavor and too dense. I followed to the T. I’ll stick to my Betty Crocker recipe

It was a sugar cookie. Everyone in my family agreed it tasted like a sugar cookie. But it was a really good sugar cookie. If I was reviewing sugar cookies it would be a five but this is supposed to be a cupcake.
Too dense.
it's very dry and no taste.
I used gluten free flower, made it a little dense but that was expected.
This was an awesome recipie. If you are looking for a simple recipe for an event I recommend this. My daughter loved these cakes and all of her friends loved it too.
Cup cakes turned out really well. Had to add little milk ( about 2Tbsp ) just to adjust the consistency of the batter which was a bit too sticky and thick.
I did the recipe to the letter and they came out very crumbly and dry. I will
The texture was very similar to cornbread.. I doubled the vanilla, added a ton of sprinkles for a pretty center, and it was still a little bland.

I followed the recipe (which only had 5 ingredients), and this was a delicious cupcake that was super simple. Even the batter seemed so different from a boxed cake mix. When I took the first bite of the cake out of the oven, it tasted like a sugar cookie. So flavorful, and you can really taste the butter. In the future, I might reduce the butter.
This cupcake was awful tasting so dense not light and fluffy at all. I thought it called for way too much eggs.

I am an absolute beginner baker but managed to make these! I HAVE NOT TRIED THESE, because they're for a family friend's birthday, but they LOOK amazing! Again, I'm rating this on appearance right now. Hopefully I can make more and try them later on! ? (Though the batter tasted very good!)
I made this but changed the tin aspect. I made a cake instead of cupcakes. It came out extremely dense with my family asking about the egg to flour ratio.

When I first made these I thought there were too little ingredients. So, when I made them, I added a little bit less then 1 tsp of baking powder and 1/2 tsp of salt to the flour whisking it together in a seperate bowl and then adding it to the wet ingredients. It turned out delicious! Also, if the cupcake batter seems a bit thick just add milk until the the batter is just right!
Great cupcake, nice and soft, fluffy texture. Pair with some vanilla buttercream frosting and you're in business. #yummy
too dry
Definitely more like a muffin (not sweet, not moist) than a cupcake.
HELLO
These are delicious, I love this recipe. I was able to add a 1/2 cup of melted chocolate ?? to the remaining part of the mix in order to make the chocolate one!

Really easy to make and delicious.. They are my first cupcakes that I've ever made from scratch so I have to compare them to box batter, the difference I've noticed is that this recipe is a little thicker than what I'm used to seeing but other than that I must say that they are AMAZING and everyone loves them.
They are full figured and fluffy, so good.
Thank you for a great recipe!

Not many people (me included) use self-rising flour on a regular basis (if at all). The recipe should bring this to the baker's attention as it was very easy to miss the first time I made this recipe. It was AWFUL!! The cupcake was dense and the flavor was off-putting. I am definitely NOT going to make this recipe again.
Absolutely disgusting
it was really tasty!!
Do not mix ingredients that long. I followed it exactly and the cupcakes turned out like a hard sponge. Next time I'll cut that timing.
The cupcakes overall were tasty. They just seemed very dry. The batter was thick and hard to mix
i will def make it again!

This recipe tastes fine but I think it is better for muffins. It doesn't really have the sweetness or fluffiness of cupcakes. It is not hard to make, however, if you want something sweeter this is not it.
My 11 year old niece made this recipe today and it was delicious, it was perfect!
Awesome recipe I added strawberry freezer jam for a filling and chocolate frosting they tasted delicious
It was okay, but it was really hard on the bottom and dry, i think it needs water, milk or veggie oil
it look yummy and it is
You added too much eggs! They tasted like egg.
it was my first cupcake ever and it was easy tô do and tasted Great, more like a cake, but delicious and Góes with every top you want or just jam. loved it.
Very moist, fluffy and yummy cupcakes. And above all very easy to make. I will definitely make them again.

Came out great. A little buttery for my taste. I added an extra 1/2 tsp of vanilla for some flavor. And I added an 1/8 cup of milk or so to make them moist (I do this with all baked goods). This recipe yielded 9 cupcakes. Since I didn't have self rising flour, I added 1.5 tsp of baking powder and estimated 3/8 tsp of salt.
it was a perfect with a yummy buttercream frosting. :)
i made one change to it i tried one time and it was to buttery and then i only put one stick of butter
I thought that it was a fantastic recipe and the cakes were sweet and fluffy!
This recipe did not work out at all. The batter curtled before I could bake it. I followed the recipe exactly.

I will not be making this again. It was very tough and I had followed all the directions and exact measurements. It tasted like a really cheap store bought cupcake and was hard like a stiff rubber. I'm opened to suggestions for a new vanilla cupcake recipe.

This cupcake was absolutely amazing. I made this for my family more than 3 times and it was perfect every time. I added gummy bears and chocolate chips to it which really added a kid to it . My brother loved it! Thank you for this amazing recipe!
I couldn't find self rising flour, so I used all purpose flour instead The cupcakes turned out dense and dry. Don't use all purpose flour for this cupcake.
Amazing!!
